intro: Forsskaolea leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is known for its latex-like sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
